key_points: Chris Cuomo, CNN host, was seen getting his COVID-19 vaccine in the Hamptons, appearing carefree and flashing the peace sign.
Reports previously alleged that Chris, along with his family, received early access to COVID-19 tests thanks to his brother, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.
Despite past controversies, Chris Cuomo did not receive preferential treatment at the Suffolk County clinic for his vaccination.
Scandals have surfaced around Governor Andrew Cuomo, including allegations of sexual harassment, underreporting COVID-19 deaths in nursing homes, and an ongoing impeachment probe.
Chris Cuomo faced backlash for the early COVID-19 testing, with critics pointing out a lack of journalistic ethics.
Pharmaceutical company Regeneron's president, Dr. George Yancopoulos, also reportedly secured special access to COVID-19 testing for himself and his family.
CNN's response to the situation emphasized the human aspect of seeking help during uncertain times, avoiding direct involvement in medical decisions of employees.
Critics attacked CNN and Chris Cuomo, highlighting ethical concerns and perceived abuse of power.
Governor Cuomo's administration defended their actions, claiming they were part of an extensive effort to identify and prevent the spread of the virus.
CNN no longer allows Governor Cuomo to be a guest on Chris Cuomoâ€™s show amidst the controversies.
spokespersons: Matt Dornic (head of strategic communications, CNN)
